description: The abductor muscles, including the tensor fasciae latae and gluteus medius, are responsible for moving the limbs away from the midline of the body.
The gluteal muscles, or glutes, are located in the buttocks and play a crucial role in hip movement, stability, and posture.
The muscles of the upper back, including the rhomboids and trapezius, are involved in movements like shoulder retraction, elevation, and rotation.
The muscles of the spine, including the erector spinae and multifidus, provide support and stability to the vertebral column, enabling movements like bending and twisting.
The hamstring muscles, located at the back of the thigh, are responsible for flexing the knee and extending the hip joint.
The abdominal muscles, commonly referred to as abs, are a group of muscles that provide core stability and support trunk movements.
The serratus anterior muscle is located on the side of the chest and rib cage and is involved in movements like pushing and pulling the arms away from the body.
The deltoid muscles, or delts, are located on the shoulder and are responsible for various arm movements like abduction, flexion, and extension.
The pectoral muscles, commonly known as pecs, are located in the chest region and are involved in movements like pushing and lifting.
The trapezius muscles, or traps, are large muscles of the upper back and neck that help with movements like shrugging, pulling, and rotating the shoulder.
The cardiovascular system includes the heart and blood vessels and is responsible for transporting oxygen, nutrients, and waste products throughout the body.
The adductor muscles are located on the inner thigh and are responsible for bringing the legs together and stabilizing the hip joint.
The triceps brachii muscles, commonly known as triceps, are located on the back of the upper arm and are responsible for extending the elbow.
The levator scapulae muscle is located at the back and side of the neck and is involved in movements like shrugging and rotating the scapula.
The latissimus dorsi muscles, or lats, are large muscles of the back that help with various movements like pulling, lifting, and swimming.
The muscles of the forearms, including the flexors and extensors, are involved in movements like gripping, bending, and rotating the wrist and fingers.
The calf muscles, including the gastrocnemius and soleus, are located in the lower leg and are responsible for plantar flexion of the foot.
The biceps brachii muscles, commonly known as biceps, are located on the front of the upper arm and are responsible for flexing the elbow and supinating the forearm.
The quadriceps muscles, located in the front of the thigh, are responsible for extending the knee and flexing the hip joint.
